text:
there is an offset and a limit feature that you can add into the query params. This could be added by an additional "loop" dividing the loop index by number of results shown and having conditionals that change the query params.

ie: page 2 links to ?pg=2 (offset's by 10 and shows 10 results) page 3 links to ?pg=3 (offset's by 20 and shows 10 results)
I posted an idea a few weeks to ago to build a custom module to support HubDB pagination and list it on the marketplace

is there a way in the dev info to see the amount of items generated from the HubDB loop? I know I can manually count them but was curious if there was a var you could output like {{content.hubdb.results}}
I ended up finding the code <@U7V9DQ31P>  posted: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7V9DQ31P/FAHSM5K97/basic_hubdb_prev_next_pagination.html>
<@U6GNQ7JBU> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U6GNQ7JBU/FBCJ5E4LD/-.txt|Untitled>
`total` is independent of the `limit` specified
one last question, and not sure if anyone has done this type of thing. Is there anyway anyone knows of where you can do the google map and return a radius from a zip code?
for example, searching for zip code 60555 and it returns all entries where a zip code is within X miles of that zip
There is a geo_filter you can use
im guessing this will help" <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/lets-build-a-page-with-a-map-with-hubdb>
lol
is there doc for the geo_filter i can review?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/get_table_rows>
Seems like you can only order by geo_distance
Not filter
I can add that functionality though
Trying to make a choice module in the new custom module design manager that pulls the ‘name’ column from a HubDB table, is that possible?
Ignore that, figured it out :see_no_evil:
Nope I lied, I’m stuck haha
Are you using hubdb_table_column() ?
I am, but I dont know how to get the actual choice module to appear in the edito
For the new custom module builder that is. I see you can pull in the table though.
Code?

{% set caseStudyChoices = hubdb_table_column(844944, “name”) %}
{% choice “caseStudiesChoice” label=“Case Studies Module: Select Case Study”, export_to_template_context=True, choices=‘{{ caseStudyChoices }}’ %}
I feel like I’ve got friday brain
